required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: TACE+Tilelizumab+Sorafenib in the Treatment of BCLC Stage C HCC
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of TACE Combined With Tilelizumab and Sorafenib in Treating BCLC Stage C HCC Patients: a Single-center, Single-arm, Prospective Clinical Study

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: According to the BCLC staging system treatment recommendation, systemic treatment is recommended for patients in BCLC stage C, and TACE and systemic treatment are recommended for patients in this stage. Studies have shown that TACE combined with sorafenib therapy has shown effectiveness in the treatment of advanced liver cancer, and PD-1 inhibitors have also shown effectiveness in the treatment of advanced liver cancer. Therefore, in order to improve the survival benefit of BCLC stage C liver cancer patients, this clinical study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of TACE combined with sorafenib and tislelizumab in the treatment of BCLC stage C liver cancer patients.

primary_outcome.description: 1-year survival rate assessed by Kaplan-Meier analysis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and up to 2 years after enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: Time to progression assessed by independent radiologic review according to mRECIST criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and up to 2 years after enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival assessed by independent radiologic review according to mRECIST criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and up to 2 years after enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: Objective response rate assessed by independent radiologic review according to mRECIST criteria

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 12 weeks and up to 2 years after enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate assessed by independent radiologic review according to mRECIST criteria

arm_group.description: TACE first combined Tilelizumab(240mg/3wks ivgtt） and Sorafenib （800mg/day orally)

intervention.description: TACE first ,and more TACE could be performed when it is necessary.
Tilelizumab 240mg per 3weeks ivgtt within 1 week after the first TACE
Sorafenib should be administered 400 mg twice /day orally within 1 week after the first TACE

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥18 years
- Child-Pugh score≤ 7
- HCC diagnosed by biopsy or by the noninvasive criteria of the Chinese Liver Cancer Guideline 2019
- the primary HCC being in BCLC C stage according to NCCN guideline
- No previous systemic therapy for HCC
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diffuse HCC
- Uncontrolled ascites of hepatic encephalopathy
- Prior liver transplantation
- Positive for human immunodeficiency virus
- Active gastric or duodenal ulcer
- Other uncontrolled comorbidities or malignancy

overall_official.affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital, College of Medicine, Zhejiang University
